summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 discussing the logistics of transferring digital evidence (on thumb drives) related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case for upload to the Relativity e-discovery platform. The emails coordinate the delivery of device extractions, confirm receipt of materials, and clarify the status of pending items and zero-byte files.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The entire email chain is about organizing and transferring evidence materials for the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, referred to as 'Maxwell upload to Relativity'.

events.title: Evidence status update and clarification
events.description: An email provides answers to outstanding questions about evidence, including the status of supplemental files, the inclusion of specific device NYCO27913, and an explanation for zero-byte files.

events.title: Coordination for thumb drive mailing
events.description: Email correspondence finalizes plans to mail a thumb drive containing folders for five specific devices (NYCO24332, NYCO24369, NYCO24369_1, NYCO24372, NYCO24384) for processing and upload to Relativity.

keyFacts: The communication is focused on managing digital evidence for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, specifically for upload to the Relativity e-discovery platform.
Multiple specific device identifiers (e.g., NYCO24332, NYCO27913) are discussed, indicating a detailed evidence inventory process.
There is mention of devices requiring hardware recovery due to physical failure, suggesting some evidence was on damaged media.
The vendor reported approximately 71,000 zero-byte (empty) files in the initial seven devices provided, which was noted as a common occurrence by the software.
The emails show a back-and-forth between parties to confirm receipt of materials, clarify discrepancies, and track pending items.
